tasks.title: [Tree2mydoor] Re-analyse ROAS experiment with full conversion lag (Dec 3-4)
tasks.notes:
**FOLLOW-UP ANALYSIS REQUIRED**

Initial analysis completed Dec 1 was premature - need to wait for conversion lag.

**Correct Analysis Periods:**
- Baseline: Nov 17-23 (7 days at 140-150% ROAS)
- Experiment: Nov 24-30 (7 days at 120% ROAS) ← Excludes Dec 1 (reverted)
- Wait until: Dec 3-4 to capture Nov 30 conversion lag

**Why Re-analysis Needed:**
1. Dec 1 was first day AFTER revert to 140-150% (not part of experiment)
2. Nov 30 conversions need 1-3 days to fully attribute
3. Current analysis shows 77% ROAS but may improve to 82-87% with lag

**Action on Dec 3-4:**
1. Query Nov 24-30 performance (7 days, excluding Dec 1)
2. Compare to baseline Nov 17-23 (7 days)
3. Update analysis document with final results

**Preliminary Findings (Dec 1):**
- Experiment ROAS: 77% (may improve to 82-87% with lag)
- Baseline ROAS: 115%
- Net: Still ~28-33pp worse even with lag adjustment
- P Max HP&P collapsed Nov 30 (10% impr share, 18% ROAS)

**File:** /Users/administrator/Documents/PetesBrain/clients/tree2mydoor/documents/black-friday-roas-experiment-analysis.md

tasks.title: [Tree2mydoor] REVERT ROAS from 120% back to 140% - Black Friday experiment ends
tasks.notes:
**CRITICAL - Time-limited experiment**

Black Friday ROAS reduction experiment:
- Changed: Nov 24, 2025
- Revert by: Tuesday Nov 25

Campaigns changed from → to:
- P Max HP&P: 140% → 120%
- P Max Unprofitable: 140% → 120%
- Search Roses: 150% → 120%
- Shopping Catch All: 150% → 120%
- Shopping Low Traffic: 140% → 120%

**REVERT ALL TO ORIGINAL VALUES unless performance significantly improved**

Check before reverting:
1. Impression share - has it recovered?
2. Spend - is it pacing higher?
3. ROAS - is it holding above breakeven?

If ROAS drops below 100% or spend explodes, revert immediately.

tasks.title: [Superspace] P0: Regenerate orders timeline chart with Nov 24 full data
tasks.notes:
**PRIORITY:** P0 - Morning task for Nov 25

**STEP 1: Download Shopify Data (DO THIS FIRST)**
1. Go to Shopify Admin: superspace-com.myshopify.com
2. Navigate to: Analytics → Reports → Orders over time
3. Set date range: Oct 1, 2025 - Nov 25, 2025
4. Export as CSV
5. Save to Downloads folder (will auto-name: "Orders over time - 2025-10-01 - 2025-11-25.csv")

**STEP 2: Update and Run Script**
1. Update CSV path in script (line 13):
   ```python
   df = pd.read_csv('/Users/administrator/Downloads/Orders over time - 2025-10-01 - 2025-11-25.csv')
   ```
2. Run visualization:
   ```bash
   cd /Users/administrator/Documents/PetesBrain/clients/superspace/analysis
   python3 orders-timeline-visualization-v2.py
   ```

**STEP 3: Review Impact**
- Check if Phase 3 budget cut (Nov 24: -10% to £9.4k/day) shows any impact on orders
- Nov 24 currently shows only 325 orders (partial day) - full data will reveal true impact

**Context:** 
Chart shows orders timeline with all 6 Google Ads budget changes marked. Need complete Nov 24 data to assess if throttle is working.

**Budget timeline:**
- Nov 13: £12,010/day (peak)
- Nov 20: £11,568/day (-20%)
- Nov 21: £10,397/day (-10%)
- Nov 24: £9,357/day (-10%) ← Need full day's data

**Files:**
- Script: `/Users/administrator/Documents/PetesBrain/clients/superspace/analysis/orders-timeline-visualization-v2.py`
- Output: `orders-timeline-oct-nov-2025.png`

tasks.title: [Tree2mydoor] Review brand campaign consolidation experiment
tasks.notes:
**EXPERIMENT: Brand Campaign Consolidation**

Paused "Brand Tree To My Door" (22485131646) on Nov 24, 2025.
Kept "Brand Inclusion" (598474059) as sole brand campaign.

**Pre-pause baseline (30 days):**
- Combined: 30.1 conversions, £473 revenue, £343 spend

**Success Criteria:**
- Brand Inclusion maintains ~30 conversions over 30 days
- No significant drop in brand coverage

**Failure Criteria:**
- Conversions drop >20% (below 24)
- Re-enable paused campaign if failing

**Check:**
1. Pull Brand Inclusion performance Nov 24 - Dec 24
2. Compare conversions to 30.1 baseline
3. Check search terms for any brand queries being missed
